headline: Anthropic appoints Microsoft veteran Irina Ghose as India MD
summary: Artificial intelligence startup Anthropic has appointed former Microsoft ​executive Irina Ghose as its ‌managing director for India, the company said ‌on Friday.  Ghose served as managing director for Microsoft's India business, a role she held for two years before ⁠leaving the ‌company in December 2025, following a 24-year career at ‍the U.S. tech major.  Anthropic, which is backed by Alphabet's Google and Amazon, is set ​to open its first India ‌office in Bengaluru in early 2026.

content.title: Anthropic appoints Microsoft veteran Irina Ghose as India MD
content.summary: Artificial intelligence startup Anthropic has appointed former Microsoft ​executive Irina Ghose as its ‌managing director for India, the company said ‌on Friday.  Ghose served as managing director for Microsoft's India business, a role she held for two years before ⁠leaving the ‌company in December 2025, following a 24-year career at ‍the U.S. tech major.  Anthropic, which is backed by Alphabet's Google and Amazon, is set ​to open its first India ‌office in Bengaluru in early 2026.

headline: OpenAI, Microsoft Lose Last Chance to Avoid Trial With Musk
summary: A federal judge in Oakland, California, on Thursday rejected requests by OpenAI and Microsoft to dismiss claims by Musk and ordered the case to proceed to a jury trial set for late April.  Musk helped Altman and others launch OpenAI in 2015 and went on to found his own artificial intelligence company in 2023.

headline: Trump Moves to Make Tech Giants Pay for Surging Power Costs
summary: The unprecedented plan, set to be announced Friday morning, seeks to address growing tensions over how the nation can supply electricity to power-hungry data centers — seen as necessary to help win the global AI race — without simultaneously hiking utility bills for homes and businesses.  The Trump administration and some US governors plan to direct grid operator PJM Interconnection LLC to hold an auction for tech companies to bid on 15-year contracts for new electricity generation capacity.

content.title: Trump Moves to Make Tech Giants Pay for Surging Power Costs
content.summary: The unprecedented plan, set to be announced Friday morning, seeks to address growing tensions over how the nation can supply electricity to power-hungry data centers — seen as necessary to help win the global AI race — without simultaneously hiking utility bills for homes and businesses.  The Trump administration and some US governors plan to direct grid operator PJM Interconnection LLC to hold an auction for tech companies to bid on 15-year contracts for new electricity generation capacity.

headline: OpenAI Is Going on a Massive Spending Spree. These Stocks Stand to Benefit.
summary: OpenAI is expected to spend nearly half a trillion dollars by 2030, according to analysts at New Street Research, as it looks to extend the lead of its ChatGPT chatbot in an increasingly competitive market for consumer artificial intelligence.  Spending could rise to an annual rate of $100 billion by 2028, New Street’s Dan Salmon and Max Spaeth said in a note published late Thursday, and sustain that pace into the end of the decade.

content.title: OpenAI Is Going on a Massive Spending Spree. These Stocks Stand to Benefit.

Spending could rise to an annual rate of $100 billion by 2028, New Street’s Dan Salmon and Max Spaeth said in a note published late Thursday, and sustain that pace into the end of the decade.

headline: Italy Investigates Microsoft's Activision Blizzard Over Game Sales
summary: The probes look into how Activision Blizzard advertised "Diablo Immortal" and "Call of Duty Mobile."  The Italian government claimed that the probes are part of its ongoing look into how mobile games make money, especially through microtransactions and in-game purchases that could trick players or encourage them to become addicted.  The investigations are just one more problem that Microsoft is having with regulators around the world since it bought Activision Blizzard for $69 billion.

content.title: Italy Investigates Microsoft's Activision Blizzard Over Game Sales
content.summary: The probes look into how Activision Blizzard advertised "Diablo Immortal" and "Call of Duty Mobile."  The Italian government claimed that the probes are part of its ongoing look into how mobile games make money, especially through microtransactions and in-game purchases that could trick players or encourage them to become addicted.  The investigations are just one more problem that Microsoft is having with regulators around the world since it bought Activision Blizzard for $69 billion.

headline: Intel Extends Comeback as Investors Bet on Foundry Growth
summary: After an 84% rally in 2025, the shares are near their highest level in two years, recovering from a 60% drop in 2024 when Intel appeared to be falling behind its rivals who were capitalizing on the AI boom.  “It’s back from the dead,” said Kim Forrest, chief investment officer at Bokeh Capital Partners and a long-time Intel shareholder.  A range of catalysts are driving the optimism: an improving financial outlook, new confidence from Wall Street as seen in recent analyst upgrades, speculation about new foundry customers, and even enthusiasm around the company’s potential to be a winner in President Trump’s “America First” campaign.

content.title: Intel Extends Comeback as Investors Bet on Foundry Growth
content.summary: After an 84% rally in 2025, the shares are near their highest level in two years, recovering from a 60% drop in 2024 when Intel appeared to be falling behind its rivals who were capitalizing on the AI boom.  “It’s back from the dead,” said Kim Forrest, chief investment officer at Bokeh Capital Partners and a long-time Intel shareholder.  A range of catalysts are driving the optimism: an improving financial outlook, new confidence from Wall Street as seen in recent analyst upgrades, speculation about new foundry customers, and even enthusiasm around the company’s potential to be a winner in President Trump’s “America First” campaign.

headline: HP Inc. Stock Will ‘Remain Pressured’ This Year. It Gets a Downgrade.
summary: The challenges  HP Inc.  faced in 2025 will continue to plague it in the new year, Barclays said.  Analyst Tim Long downgraded shares of HP to Underweight from Equal Weight on Friday, cutting his price target to $18 from $24.  The stock is trading at 6.6 times the earnings per share expected over the next 12 months, compared with the five-year average of 8.4 times.

content.title: HP Inc. Stock Will ‘Remain Pressured’ This Year. It Gets a Downgrade.
content.summary: The challenges  HP Inc.  faced in 2025 will continue to plague it in the new year, Barclays said.  Analyst Tim Long downgraded shares of HP to Underweight from Equal Weight on Friday, cutting his price target to $18 from $24.  The stock is trading at 6.6 times the earnings per share expected over the next 12 months, compared with the five-year average of 8.4 times.

headline: How Amazon, Microsoft's growth went from 'stupendous' to 'nice'
summary: Research Affiliates Founder and chairman of the board Rob Arnott sits down with Market Catalysts Anchor Julie Hyman to have a conversation dissecting Wall Street's perceptions of growth and value stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC), going on to make such cases for Magnificent Seven tech companies Nvidia (NVDA), Amazon (AMZN), and Microsoft (MSFT). Also watch Rob Arnott share his perspective on how fiscal stimulus mainly works to bolster wealth and asset bubbles, not the economy. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

Also watch Rob Arnott share his perspective on how fiscal stimulus mainly works to bolster wealth and asset bubbles, not the economy.

headline: US FTC to scrutinize Big Tech's talent acquisition deals, Bloomberg News reports
summary: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is scrutinizing big tech firms that hire employees of ​a startup instead of buying the companies outright, Bloomberg ‌News reported on Friday, citing the agency's Chairman Andrew Ferguson.  "We are beginning to examine these acqui-hires ⁠to make sure they ‌are not an attempt to get around" the agency’s merger review process, Ferguson said in ‍an interview with Bloomberg Television.  Last month, Nvidia agreed to license chip technology from startup Groq and hire away its CEO Jonathan Ross, ​a veteran of Alphabet's Google.

content.title: US FTC to scrutinize Big Tech's talent acquisition deals, Bloomberg News reports
content.summary: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is scrutinizing big tech firms that hire employees of ​a startup instead of buying the companies outright, Bloomberg ‌News reported on Friday, citing the agency's Chairman Andrew Ferguson.  "We are beginning to examine these acqui-hires ⁠to make sure they ‌are not an attempt to get around" the agency’s merger review process, Ferguson said in ‍an interview with Bloomberg Television.  Last month, Nvidia agreed to license chip technology from startup Groq and hire away its CEO Jonathan Ross, ​a veteran of Alphabet's Google.

thumbnail.caption: FILE PHOTO: A view of the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) headquarters in Washington, D.C.

content.summary: If you want to bet that Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA), and Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) will continue dominating the market, Vanguard Mega Cap Index Fund ETF Shares (NYSEARCA:MGC) offers a straightforward way to do it. headline: Trump Has a New Plan to Power AI. GE Vernova Stock and Others Should Benefit.
summary: Trump and several governors are pushing a plan to spur new power plants for AI data centers. Equipment makers jumped, while owners of existing plants fell.
